ArticleInfo.ArticleTitle: Connections between Hyers-Ulam stability and uniform exponential stability of discrete evolution families of bounded linear operators over Banach spaces

License.SimplePara: Open Access This article is distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/), which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided you give appropriate credit to the original author(s) and the source, provide a link to the Creative Commons license, and indicate if changes were made.

Affiliation.OrgDivision: LinDa Institute of Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Network Based Intelligent Computing

Abstract.Heading: Abstract
Abstract.Para:
In this article, we prove that the ω-periodic discrete evolution family
Γ : = { ρ ( n , k ) : n , k ∈
Z +
, n ≥ k }
$\Gamma:= \{\rho(n,k): n, k \in\mathbb{Z}_{+}, n\geq k\}$ of bounded linear operators is Hyers-Ulam stable if and only if it is uniformly exponentially stable under certain conditions. More precisely, we prove that if for each real number γ and each sequence
( ξ ( n ) )
$(\xi(n))$ taken from some Banach space, the approximate solution of the nonautonomous ω-periodic discrete system
θ
n + 1
=
Λ n
θ n
$\theta _{n+1} = \Lambda_{n}\theta_{n}$ ,
n ∈
Z +
$n\in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ is represented by
ϕ
n + 1
=
Λ n
ϕ n
+
e
i γ ( n + 1 )
ξ ( n + 1 )
$\phi _{n+1}=\Lambda_{n}\phi_{n}+e^{i\gamma(n+1)}\xi(n+1)$ ,
n ∈
Z +
$n\in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ ;
ϕ 0
=
θ 0
$\phi_{0}=\theta_{0}$ , then the Hyers-Ulam stability of the nonautonomous ω-periodic discrete system
θ
n + 1
=
Λ n
θ n
$\theta_{n+1} = \Lambda_{n}\theta_{n}$ ,
n ∈
Z +
$n\in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ is equivalent to its uniform exponential stability.

KeywordGroup.Heading: Keywords
KeywordGroup.Keyword: discrete evolution family of bounded linear operators

Section1.Heading: Introduction
Section1.Para:
The stability theory is an important research area of the qualitative analysis of differential equations and difference equations. Ulam [1] proposed a question regarding the stability of functional equations for homomorphism as follows: when can an approximate homomorphism from a group
G 1
$G_{1}$
to a metric group
G 2
$G_{2}$
be approximated by an exact homomorphism? Assuming that
G 1
$G_{1}$ and
G 2
$G_{2}$ are Banach spaces, Hyers [2] brilliantly gave the first result to this question. Aoki [3] and Rassias [4] generalized this result. In particular, Rassias [4] improved the condition for the bound of the norm of the Cauchy difference
f ( x + y ) − f ( x ) − f ( y )
$f(x+y)-f(x)-f(y)$ . Obłoza [5] established the connections between Hyers and Lyapunov stability of ordinary differential equations. Later on, Alsina and Ger [6] investigated the stability of the differential equation
y ′
( x ) = y ( x )
$y'(x) = y(x)$ , which was then extended to the Banach space-valued differential equation
y ′
( x ) = λ y ( x )
$y'(x)=\lambda y(x)$ by Takahasi et al. [7]. We also refer the reader to [8–11] regarding the study of Hyers-Ulam stability of differential equations and differential operators.

The stability and nonstability of different classes of recurrences were studied by Brzdȩk et al. [12–14] and Popa [15, 16]. Jung [17] proved the Hyers-Ulam stability of a first-order linear homogeneous matrix difference equation. Note that the investigation of the difference equations
θ
n + 1
=
Λ n
θ n
$\theta_{n+1}=\Lambda_{n}\theta_{n}$ or
θ
n + 1
=
Λ n
θ n
+
ξ n
$\theta_{n+1}=\Lambda_{n}\theta_{n}+\xi_{n}$ leads to the idea of discrete evolution family. The main interest in this area is the asymptotic properties and stability of solutions to such systems. In recent years, the exponential stability of such systems has received a great deal of attention since it has been widely applied in research of control theory and engineering; see, e.g., [18–25] and the references cited therein.

In this paper, we are concerned with the first-order linear system
1.1
θ
n + 1
=
Λ n
θ n
,
n ∈
Z +
,
$$ \theta_{n+1}=\Lambda_{n}\theta_{n}, \quad n \in\mathbb{Z}_{+}, $$ where
Z +
$\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ is the set of all nonnegative integers and
(
Λ n
)
$(\Lambda_{n})$ is an ω-periodic sequence of bounded linear operators on Banach space Ω. We proved that system (1.1) is Hyers-Ulam stable if and only if it is uniformly exponentially stable under certain conditions.

ξ ( 0 ) = 0
$\xi(0)=0$ , and we denote by

$\mathcal {L}(\Omega)$ .

Section1.Para:
The family
Γ : = { ρ ( n , m ) : n , m ∈
Z +
, n ≥ m }
$\Gamma:= \{\rho(n,m): n, m \in\mathbb{Z}_{+}, n\geq m\} $ of bounded linear operators is called an ω-periodic discrete evolution family for a fixed integer
ω ∈ { 2 , 3 , … }
$\omega\in\{2,3,\ldots\}$ if it satisfies the following properties:
ρ ( n , n ) = I
$\rho(n,n)=I$ for all
n ∈
Z +
$n \in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ .
ρ ( n , m ) ρ ( m , r ) = ρ ( n , r )
$\rho(n,m)\rho(m,r)=\rho(n,r)$ for all
n ≥ m ≥ r
$n\geq m\geq r$ ,
n , m , r ∈
Z +
$n,m, r \in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ .
ρ ( n + ω , m + ω ) = ρ ( n , m )
$\rho(n+\omega,m+\omega)=\rho(n,m)$ for all
n ≥ m
$n\geq m$ ,
n , m ∈
Z +
$n, m\in \mathbb{Z}_{+}$ .
It is well known that any ω-periodic discrete evolution family Γ is exponentially bounded, that is, there exist a
τ ∈ R
$\tau\in\mathbb{R}$ and an
M τ
≥ 0
$M_{\tau}\geq0$ such that
2.1
∥ ρ ( n , m ) ∥
≤
M τ
e
τ ( n − m )
for all n ≥ m , n , m ∈
Z +
.
$$ \bigl\Vert \rho(n,m) \bigr\Vert \leq M_{\tau}e^{\tau(n-m)} \quad \mbox{for all } n\geq m, n, m\in{\mathbb{Z}_{+}}. $$ When the family Γ is exponentially bounded, its growth bound
τ 0
( Γ )
$\tau_{0}(\Gamma)$ is the infimum of all
τ ∈ R
$\tau\in\mathbb{R}$ for which there exists an
M τ
≥ 1
$M_{\tau}\geq1$ such that inequality (2.1) is fulfilled. It is well known that
τ 0
( Γ ) =
lim
n → ∞
ln ∥ ρ ( n , 0 ) ∥
n
=
1 ω
ln
( r
( ρ ( ω , 0 ) )
)
.
$$\tau_{0}(\Gamma)=\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}{\frac{\ln \Vert \rho (n,0)\Vert }{n}}={ \frac{1}{\omega}}\ln \bigl(r \bigl(\rho(\omega,0) \bigr) \bigr). $$ The family Γ is uniformly exponentially stable if
τ 0
( Γ )
$\tau_{0}(\Gamma )$ is negative or, equivalently, there exist an
M > 0
$M>0$ and a
τ > 0
$\tau>0$ such that
∥ ρ ( n , m ) ∥ ≤ M
e
− τ ( n − m )
$\Vert \rho(n,m)\Vert \leq Me^{-\tau(n-m)}$ for all
n ≥ m ∈
Z +
$n\geq m\in{\mathbb{Z}_{+}}$ . Thus, we have the following lemma.

FormalPara.Heading: Lemma 2.3
FormalPara.Para:
The discrete evolution family Γ is uniformly exponentially stable if and only if
r ( ρ ( ω , 0 ) ) < 1
$r(\rho{(\omega,0))}<1$ .

ρ ( ω , 0 )

$$\begin{aligned} L_{1} =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\sum _{k=1+j\omega}^{\omega-1+j\omega}e^{i \gamma k}\rho(l\omega+r,k) (k-j\omega) \bigl[(1+j)\omega-k \bigr]\rho(k-j\omega,0) \\ =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\sum _{k=1+j\omega}^{\omega-1+j\omega}e^{i \gamma k}\rho(l\omega+r,k) (k-j \omega) \bigl[(1+j)\omega-k \bigr]\rho(k,j\omega) \\ =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\sum _{k=1+j\omega}^{\omega-1+j\omega}e^{i \gamma k}\rho(l\omega+r,j\omega) (k-j\omega) \bigl[(1+j)\omega-k \bigr] \\ =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\rho(l\omega+r,j\omega) \sum_{k=1+j\omega}^{\omega-1+j\omega}e^{i \gamma k}(k-j\omega) \bigl[(1+j)\omega-k \bigr] \\ =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\rho(l\omega+r,j\omega) \sum_{k=1+j\omega}^{\omega-1+j\omega}e^{i \gamma k}(k-j\omega) \bigl[\omega-(k-j\omega) \bigr] \\ =&\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}\rho(r,0) \rho^{l-j}(\omega,0)e^{i \gamma j\omega}\sum_{v=1}^{\omega-1}e^{i \gamma v}v( \omega-v) \\ =&\rho(r,0)\sum_{v=1}^{\omega-1}e^{i \gamma v}v( \omega-v)\sum_{j=0}^{l-1}e^{i \gamma j\omega} \rho^{l-j}(\omega,0) \\ =&\rho(r,0)\sum_{v=1}^{\omega-1}e^{i \gamma v}v( \omega-v)\sum_{\alpha=1}^{l}e^{i \gamma \omega{(l-\alpha)}} \rho^{\alpha}(\omega,0) \\ =&\rho(r,0)\sum_{v=1}^{\omega-1}e^{i \gamma v}v( \omega-v)e^{i \gamma l\omega}\sum_{\alpha=1}^{l}e^{-i \gamma \omega \alpha} \rho^{\alpha}(\omega,0) \\ =&G(\gamma,\omega)\sum_{\alpha=1}^{l}e^{-i \gamma \omega\alpha} \rho^{\alpha}(\omega,0), \end{aligned}$$ where

$r(\rho(\omega,0))<1$ . Hence, by Lemma 2.3, Γ is uniformly exponentially stable. This completes the proof. □

Section1.Para: On the basis of Theorem 3.1, we obtain the following corollary as the main result of this paper.

FormalPara.Heading: Corollary 3.2
FormalPara.Para:
Assume that for each
γ ∈ R
$\gamma\in\mathbb{R}$
and each sequence
( ξ ( n ) ) ∈ W
$(\xi (n))\in\mathcal{W}$ , the approximate solution of the nonautonomous ω-periodic discrete system (1.1) is presented by
ϕ
n + 1
=
Λ n
ϕ n
+
e
i γ ( n + 1 )
ξ ( n + 1 )
$\phi _{n+1}=\Lambda_{n}\phi_{n}+e^{i\gamma(n+1)}\xi(n+1)$ ,
n ∈
Z +
$n\in\mathbb{Z}_{+}$ ;
ϕ 0
=
θ 0
$\phi_{0}=\theta_{0}$ . Then the Hyers-Ulam stability of (1.1) is equivalent to its uniform exponential stability.
